articles.author: Daniel Ramos
articles.description: Bolivian armed forces took over the capital's central square on Wednesday, and an armored vehicle rammed through the entrance to the presidential palace followed by soldiers rushing in, igniting fears of a military coup.
articles.title: Bolivian soldiers surge into presidential palace, raising specter of coup

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded several areas across Gaza on Wednesday, and residents reported fierce fighting overnight in Rafah in the south of the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Israeli forces pound north and south Gaza, battle Hamas in Rafah

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: The U.S. State Department said on Wednesday its involvement in the resolution of Julian Assange's case was very limited but a department spokesperson reiterated the American position that the WikiLeaks founder's actions had put lives at risk.
articles.title: US State Department says Julian Assange's actions put people at risk

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant said on Wednesday there had been significant progress made addressing the issue of U.S. munitions supply to Israel during his meetings with Biden administration officials in Washington this week.
articles.title: Israeli defense chief says progress made on munitions supply in US talks

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Protesters vowed to keep up demonstrations against new tax hikes a day after police opened fire on crowds trying to storm parliament, killing at least five people and wounding dozens.
articles.title: Kenyan protesters promise more rallies

articles.author: Kylie Maclellan, Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Labour leader Keir Starmer went head-to-head on Wednesday in their last debate before an election next week, with both launching highly personal attacks over their and their parties' credibility.
articles.title: Sunak and Starmer clash in testy final UK TV debate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Poland, Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia called on Wednesday for the European Union to build a defence line along the bloc's border with Russia and Belarus to protect the EU from military threats and other harmful activities from Moscow.
articles.title: Poland, Baltics call for EU defence line on border with Russia, Belarus

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea has successfully conducted an important test aimed at developing missiles carrying multiple warheads, state media KCNA said on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea claims successful test to develop multiple warhead missile

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A United Nations-led meeting with Afghanistan's Taliban in Qatar this weekend will not be a discussion about international recognition of the group, U.N. political affairs chief Rosemary DiCarlo said on Wednesday.
articles.title: UN-led Doha meeting with Taliban not about recognition, says UN

articles.author: Kanishka Singh, Simon Lewis
articles.description: The U.S. State Department's 2023 religious freedom report on India noted violent attacks on minority groups, especially Muslims and Christians, including killings, assaults and vandalism of houses of worship.
articles.title: US religious freedom report notes violence against Indian minorities
